[8th February, 1887 ] 
 
An Act to vest the Port of Karachi in a Trust  
 
Preamble , Whereas it is expedient to vest the Port of Karachi in a true and to provide  
for the management of the affairs of the said port by trustees; It is enacted as follows: - 
 
I – PRELIMINARY  
 
1. Short Title – This Act may be called the Karachi Port Trust Act, 1886.   
2. Definitions – In this Act, unless there be something repugnant in the subje ct or 
context: - 
(1) “Port”  means the port of Karachi as defined for the purpose of this Act ; 
 
(2) “high -water mark”  means a line drawn through the highest points reached by 
ordinary spring -tides at any season of the year.  
 
(3) “low -water mark” means a line drawn through the lowest points reached 
by ordinary spring -tides at any season of the year.  
 
(4) “land” includes the bed of the sea below high -water mark, and also things  
attached to the earth or permanently fastened to anything attached to the earth;  
 
(5) “master” when  used in relation to any vessel, means any person having for the  
time being the charge or control of such vessel;  
 
(6) the word “goods”  includes wares and merchandise of every description;  
 
2[(7)  “owner” when used in relation to goods includes any consignor, consignee,  
shipper, agent for shipping, clearing or removing such goods, or agent for the sale or 
custody of such goods; and when used in relation to any vessel includes any part -owner, 
charterer, consignee or mortgage, in possession thereof. ]

 Such limits may extend to any part of the navigable approaches to the port, and may include 
any wharves, tramways, warehouses; sheds and other works made on behalf of the public for 
convenience of traffic, for safety of vessels or for the improvement, main tenance and good 
government of the port, whether within or without high -water mark, and , subject to any rights 
of private property therein, any portion of the shore within fifty yards of high -water mark.

An agreement made this the 18th day of January one thousand nine hundred and o ne between the 
Municipality of Karachi of the one part and the Trustees of the Port of Karachi of the other part, whereby it is 
agreed as follows : — 
1. The Municipality of Karachi (hereinafter called the Municipality) agrees to sell and the Trustee of  
the Port of Karachi (hereinafter called the Trustees) agree to purchase at or for the price of Rs. (18.054 -5-0) 
eighteen thousand and fifty -four and annas five only, to be paid as hereinafter mentioned, all that eight -inch water 
main now laid an extending from  the Currie Reservoir to the Travellers' Bungalow at the junction of Preedy and 
Bunder Roads and all the iron piping connections and all appurtenances to the said main belonging or appertaining 
thereto.  
 
2.  The Trustees shall lay a six -inch main from the point where the said eight -inch main terminates, 
joining up one with the other, and carry such six -inch main along the Bunder Road as far as the Merewether Clock 
Tower then across the road into the Port Trust Import Yard along the cart road in front of the  Platform Sheds 
joining the Bunder Road after passing the Custom House on its south side and along the Napier Mole Road to 
any such point or points at Keamari as the Trustees may now or at any time hereafter deem necessary or expedient.  
 
3. The Trustees sh all be at liberty to open up all roads along which the said six -inch main is to be laid 
to such depth or width as may be reasonably necessary, provided always that any road or portion of road so opened 
up shall be closed and restored to its original condit ion as soon as the main has been laid and provided also that 
the Trustees shall fence the road so opened and take all the necessary precautions to avoid injury etc., to passengers 
and vehicular traffic. The work of laying the main shall, when commenced, co ntinue without interruption until 
completion.  
 
4.  The pipe shall wherever practicable, be laid at such a depth below the surface of the road that there 
shall be at least two feet of filling over every portion of the same.  
 
5.  During the construction of t he main the Engineer of the Municipality shall at all times have access 
to the works for the purpose of satisfying the Municipality that the laying of the pipes is being satisfactory carried 
out. 
 
6.  The Trustees shall pay to the Municipality the said sum  of Rs. 18.054 -5-0 herein agreed to be paid 
one the completion of the six -inch main and when the new 6 annas rate comes into force.  
 
7. During the continuance of this agreement the whole of the said main from the Currie Reservoir to   
Keamari shall be the exclusive property of the Trustees, and the Trustees shall maintain and keep the same in 
proper repair and do all renewals add other works necessary for the proper unkeep of the line in such a manner 
that whenever, during the continuance of this agreement and under the terms thereof or when on the expiration of 
30 years the line is taken over by the Municipality it shall be in a thoroughly good and satisfactory condition to 
fulfil at that time the functions for which it was originally laid. The Port Trust i n fact agree to hand over the main 
in the same satisfactory conditions as the Municipality would reasonably be expected to have maintained had it 
been their own property. That in case of any dispute between the Municipality and the Port Trust as to the 
satisfactory condition of the pipes at the time they are taken over by the Municipality, the dispute shall be referred  
to the Commissioner in Sind for final decision.

9. So long as this agreement shall remain in force the said main shall be used by the Trustees for the 
following purposes only, that is to say, for the work of the Port Trust and for the supply of water to ships and to 
Manora through the Port Trust, and no branches shall be taken from the said main for the supply of water to any

inch main be measured by a meter to be supplied fitted and maintained in proper working order by the Trustees

accuracy of the meter adopted either party may put in a second meter on any portion of the six or eight -inch main

annas per one thousand (1,000) gallons; payment to accrue due on the 1st day of each calendar month and to be

Trustees of their intention so to do. In the event of any difference of opin ion between the Port Trust and the 
Municipality as to weather it is necessary in the interests of the public to close the valve, the question shall be 
referred to the Commissioner in Sind, whose decision shall be final on the point, but the valve shall in such case 
not be closed until the Commissioner in Sind's decision is given.  
 
14. During the continuance of this agreement the Municipality shall not make any connec tion or branch 
to or from any part of the said main, nor shall the Municipality do or suffer  to be done anything whereby the said 
main or any part thereof shall be injured or exposed to injury, or whereby the free flow of water from the Currie 
Reservoir (subject to the provision made in clause 13) into and through the whole length of the said mai n to 
Keamari shall be obstructed or in any way impeded.
